name: classical mechanics
description: Branch of physics that deals with the motion of macroscopic objects under the influence of forces| following principles established by Isaac Newton.

name: dynamics
description: A branch of mechanics that deals with forces and their relation primarily to the motion but sometimes also to the equilibrium of bodies.

name: statics
description: Branch of classical mechanics that is concerned with the analysis of force and torque acting on a physical system that does not experience an acceleration| but rather is in equilibrium with its environment.

name: acceleration
description: The rate of change of the velocity of an object with respect to time.

name: force
description: Influence that can cause an object to change its velocity unless counterbalanced by other forces.

name: frame of reference
description: Abstract coordinate system whose origin| orientation| and scale are specified by a set of reference pointsâ€“geometric points whose position is identified both mathematically and physically.

name: impulse
description: Change in momentum of an object.

name: inertia
description: Tendency of object in motion to stay in motion and objects at rest to stay at rest.

name: weight
description: Force acting on an object due to acceleration of gravity.

name: mass
description: Intrinsic property of a body. Believed to be related to the quantity of matter in a body| until the discovery of the atom and particle physics. It was found that different atoms and different elementary particles| theoretically with the same amount of matter| have different masses.

name: momentum
description: Product of the mass and velocity of an object.

name: space
description: Three-dimensional continuum containing positions and directions.

name: speed
description: The magnitude of the change of its position over time.

name: time
description: Continued sequence of existence and events that occurs in an apparently irreversible succession from the past| through the present| and into the future. It is component quantity of various measurements used to sequence events| to compare the duration of events or the intervals between them| and to quantify rates of change of quantities in material reality or in the conscious experience. Time is often referred to as a fourth dimension| along three spatial dimensions.

name: torque
description: Rotational analogue of linear force. It is also referred to as the moment of force| or abbreviated to moment. Just as a linear force is a push or pull applied to a body| a torque can be thought of as twist applied to an object with respect to a chosen point.

name: velocity
description: The speed in combination with the direction of motion of an object.

name: newton
description: The unit of force in the international system of units (SI). One newton is| the force needed to accelerate one kilogram of mass at the rate of one metre per second squared in the direction of the applied force.

name: first law of motion
description: A body remains at rest| or in motion at a constant speed in a straight line| except insofar as it is acted upon by a force.

name: second law of motion
description: At any instant of time| the net force on a body is equal to the body's acceleration multiplied by its mass or| equivalently| the rate at which the body's momentum is changing with time.

name: third law of motion
description: If two bodies exert forces on each other| these forces have the same magnitude but opposite direction.

name: free fall
description: Any motion of a body where gravity is the only force acting upon it.

name: body
description: Collection of matter with a defined contiguous border in three-dimensional space.

name: newtons law of gravitation
description: Every particle attracts every other particle in the universe with a force that is proportional to the product of their masses, and inversly proportional to the square of the distance between their centers.

name: gravity
description: Fundamental interaction observed as mutual attraction between all things that have mass.

name: vacuum
description: Space devoid of matter.

name: distance
description: Mesurement of how far apart the objects are.

name: center of mass
description: A point at any given time where the
